Description: Part of a neck opening of a tunic; two bands of tapestry have been applied and sewn to undyed, plainw weave linen; the first part a)=(clavus?) is 23x5.5cm, at the lower part is the head of a human figure, the other decoration is too damaged to identify and the surface is covered in dust and salt; b)=second part (6x5cm) is part of a neck band, very damaged and dirty; plain weave: warp/weft-undyed linen (S/12-14), edges are cut apart from the inside of the neck opening - this is hemmed under the tapestry; tapestry a): warp-undyed linen (S spun Z ply/11), weft-undyed linen (S/56), red, yellow, green and dark blue wool (S), selvedges have been hemmed and sewn with undyed linen threads (S spun Z ply) in oversewing, other edges cut and ragged; tapestry b): warp-linen? (S spun Z ply?/7), weft-orange and brown wool (damaged), two selvedges are reinforced, one edge is under the other tapestry and the other edge is cut
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
